column1: Describe the three methods which Faraday induced a current within a coil of wire.
Describe the resulting motion of charges within a conductor which is moving in the presence of a magnetic field.
Calculate the induced potential difference due to motion of a conductor in the presence of a magnetic field.
Solve for induced current magnitude and direction due to motion of a conductor within a closed circuit in the presence of a magnetic field.
Determine the magnetic flux through a given plane surface to the direction and magnitude of the magnetic field.
Apply Lenz's Law to determine the direction of an induced current through a loop of wire due to a changing magnetic flux.
Use Faraday's law to calculate the induced potential difference and induced current due to a changing magnetic flux.
